name: NPR
text:
Uber is buying Postmates in a $2.65 billion all-stock deal, as the company sees falling demand for rides. With the acquisition, UberEats will represent 37% of food delivery services in the U.S.
https://t.co/VDnRyqA7l9

name: NPR
text:
The border between Australian states Victoria and New South Wales will close due to a coronavirus outbreak.

Victoria, whose capital city is Melbourne, logged 127 cases in 24 hours ‚Äî 90% of Australia's infections during that period.
https://t.co/xJ1r254944

name: NPR
text:
A new survey finds 9% of adults age 18-29 have moved due to the COVID-19 pandemic. 

Some people moved to avoid catching the virus, while others were forced by the closing of college campuses. https://t.co/3NsflKqwif

name: NPR
text:
"We sent a message that we had defeated COVID-19 and we had not," Phoenix Mayor Kate Gallego says. 

"We are really in a bad situation where we need more resources for our medical system and help with testing."
https://t.co/RjAkRNQ2EE

name: NPR
text:
A new U.N. report warns that more diseases that pass from animals to humans, such as COVID-19, are likely to emerge as habitats are ravaged by wildlife exploitation, unsustainable farming practices and climate change.
https://t.co/WHqYDLEGZK

name: NPR
text: Foreign students attending U.S. colleges will have to leave the country or transfer to ‚Äúa school with in-person instruction‚Äù if their college operates entirely online this fall, according to new federal regulations. https://t.co/yvfAw5iCrX

name: NPR
text: Though it features members of Interpol, The Walkmen and Bonny Light Horseman ‚Äî Muzz says the term "supergroup" doesn't apply. https://t.co/bx1gDg3HEE

name: NPR
text:
When 15-year-old Jyoti Kumari pedaled 700 miles home with her ailing father, she gained worldwide attention ‚Äî and a movie deal. 

But critics say that attention is romanticizing poverty.  "Are we thinking about why Jyoti had to make that journey at all?"
https://t.co/ZAgUhHMmGs

name: NPR
text:
Do you want houseplants but worry about keeping them alive? Here's a quick @nprlifekit guide to making a plant happy, including:
 
üåµ Get a pot with a drainage hole
üå• LOW light doesn‚Äôt mean NO light
üíß Water when the top ~2 inches of soil are dry
https://t.co/6lw7GfyWiw https://t.co/vLUC8ZH22q

name: NPR
text:
Like most good memoirs, Gail Caldwell's latest is a reassessment of life choices, roads taken and others foregone. 

"At some point you shuffle the cards and call the deck a life," she writes.  https://t.co/xX8EVp1njb

name: NPR
text:
The ways people and sometimes policymakers respond to disasters can have hidden and unintended consequences. 

And sometimes those consequences can be tragic. 

The latest from @theindicator: https://t.co/xnRk5uDFT1

name: NPR
text: "Friends and Strangers" examines the relationship between a mother and her child's caregiver ‚Äî both women with significant degrees of privilege, despite their surface economic differences. https://t.co/lpl1WNxoNV

name: NPR
text:
Join jazz vocalist Jazzmeia Horn and @JazzNight's Christian McBride in a live chat on Wed., July 8, at 10:30 a.m. EDT to watch a performance from Horn‚Äôs Love and Liberation tour. 

Info: https://t.co/vaqHBHSYpp

Until then, here‚Äôs Horn singing her original tune "Free Your Mind.‚Äù https://t.co/z5E1Xxygkm

name: NPR
text: Aspiring educators usually spend their last semester of college preparing for certification exams and  student teaching ‚Äî but that training was interrupted this year. Here‚Äôs a look at how they‚Äôre adapting ‚¨áÔ∏è (@WBEZ) https://t.co/GGO6XyIprC

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Tammy Duckworth condemned what she called President Trump's use of the military "for political gain."

"We dishonor the sacrifice of our troops when we politicize them," she said.
https://t.co/BphNdzzaFW

name: NPR
text: .@HiddenBrain goes back to 1979 to uncover the harm that happened when flawed ideas from psychology ‚Äî ideas that continue to pervade some courtrooms today ‚Äî were used to put a teenager behind bars for life. https://t.co/E39o6zjgyJ

name: NPR
text:
A letter by West Point alumni is calling on the academy's leadership to improve anti-racism training, investigate the disciplinary system for racially discriminatory punishments and remove monuments honoring the Confederacy.
https://t.co/RA68nY3AhO

name: NPR
text:
Armed militias continue to show up at protests across the U.S. But after a protester was shot in Albuquerque, local leaders are telling them to stay away.

"We're just trying to send a clear signal that we never want vigilantes in our town," the mayor says
https://t.co/6Bfut2bJyO

name: NPR
text:
RT @npratc: A new batch of government data provides the clearest picture so far of just how disproportionately people of color are affected by the coronavirus. Today on #NPRConsiderThis, we look at those numbers and how the government was forced to release them.
https://t.co/2gquqzOPGB

name: NPR
text:
India's death toll from COVID-19 passed 20,000 on Tuesday, with its total number of cases now exceeding 700,000 ‚Äî making it the third worst-affected country by the coronavirus, in terms of total infections.
https://t.co/jfDLPcggnB

name: NPR
text:
Officials in Australia have announced a six-week lockdown in Melbourne and the closure of Victoria's border with New South Wales.

It comes after 191 new coronavirus cases were confirmed in the past 24 hours.
https://t.co/wEG89MMMcY

name: NPR
text:
Family violence increases in places that have been severely burned in bushfires, Australian research finds. The isolation and financial stress of COVID-19 appear to be exacerbating the problem.
https://t.co/tIDgZJhUJe

name: NPR
text:
Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, who has consistently downplayed the dangers of COVID-19, has tested positive for the coronavirus.

Brazil has world's second-largest outbreak ‚Äî with more than 1.6 million confirmed cases.
https://t.co/reya34DuMB

name: NPR
text:
Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro ‚Äî who has consistently downplayed the dangers of COVID-19 ‚Äî has tested positive for the coronavirus.

It comes as Brazil grapples with the second-largest outbreak in the world.
https://t.co/XfFA7kwLDw

name: NPR
text:
Where do you get your news?

Today's How I Built Resilience conversation features @Blavity founder and CEO @MorganDeBaun.

Morgan started the media platform when she was 24. What questions should @guyraz ask? https://t.co/OLgvs4v9Eq

name: NPR
text:
Opinion: With America's international aid and moral standing shrinking‚Äîand its adversaries on the rise‚Äîsome of the nation's most seasoned diplomats are pinning their hopes on private companies to help shore up democracy, writes former diplomat Brett Bruen.
https://t.co/Di0W3h2z8v

name: NPR
text:
Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms has tested positive for the coronavirus.

She said doctors told her that she had a "low positive" test, meaning she was either at the beginning or near the end of her infection.
https://t.co/U07gu36Bfw

name: NPR
text:
The Trump administration is pushing to reopen schools this fall, even as COVID-19 cases spike around the U.S.

But so far, the administration hasn't offered concrete proposals for how states might mitigate risk to students‚Äînor committed to new federal aid.
https://t.co/W21NcnReP8

name: NPR
text:
Honeybees in the U.S. are struggling.

Entomologist @Sammy_Ramsey walks #NPRShortWave through the "three Ps" ‚Äî a deadly trio of factors that are killing honeybees and what you can do to help the bees in your own backyard.
https://t.co/5aGTxxjSZd

name: NPR
text: Israel's top public health official resigned Tuesday, claiming leaders ignored her warnings and reopened the country too quickly ‚Äî driving a new surge of COVID-19 cases.  https://t.co/oMfsY5hjUf

name: NPR
text:
Journalist Kim Wall was 30 when she was murdered by a source.

Her parents have set up a fund for female reporters, working to make sure her name won't be a warning ‚Äî but a tag under ambitious investigative pieces, a line on resumes, a calling card.
https://t.co/1J2FfhJ4Ji

name: NPR
text:
After some legal wrangling, excerpts from an incendiary book by President Trump's niece are starting to surface. 

‚ÄúUnlike any previous time in his life, Donald's failings cannot be hidden or ignored because they threaten us all," writes Mary Trump. 
https://t.co/RTrkPZYuHB

name: NPR
text:
President Trump said the U.S. targeted Iranian Maj. Gen. Qassem Soleimani to prevent an imminent threat. 

But a U.N. investigator says the U.S. has not produced any proof to back its claim.
https://t.co/5rgLLX4Uhi

name: NPR
text:
The WNBA says it will dedicate the 2020 season to addressing the nation's "long history of inequality, implicit bias and racism."

Players will wear warmup shirts with the words "Say Her Name" and "Black Lives Matter."
https://t.co/tIMctcAQtR
